chapterSummary.General: Exodus 5 recounts the confrontation between Moses, Aaron, and Pharaoh, and the increased oppression of the Israelites. The chapter demonstrates the resistance of human power to God's will, the testing of faith, and the suffering that often precedes deliverance.
chapterSummary.Non-Denominational: Focuses on the confrontation with Pharaoh, the resistance to God's will, and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Baptist: Emphasizes the sovereignty of God over human rulers and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Catholic: Highlights the confrontation with Pharaoh, the resistance to God's will, and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Methodist: Focuses on the confrontation with Pharaoh and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Lutheran: Emphasizes the sovereignty of God over human rulers and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Presbyterian: Stresses the covenantal faithfulness of God in the face of human resistance.
chapterSummary.Pentecostal: Highlights the confrontation with Pharaoh and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Anglican: Emphasizes the sovereignty of God over human rulers and the testing of faith.
chapterSummary.Orthodox: Focuses on the confrontation with Pharaoh, the resistance to God's will, and the testing of faith.
